page.title: 01GENERAL REVIEW OF STEWARTON
page.content: STEWARTON and the surrounding farm lands lie mainly in the valley of the Annick Water and its tributaries in the rolling uplands of the NE area of Ayr Division in Strathclyde,22 kms from Glasgow.It is mainly a dormitory town of around 9000 inhabitants who travel to nearby work centres.Nearly all the farms in the area are dairy. From many viewpoints,on a clear day, the island of Arran and the Firth of Clyde,the Kilbirnie Hills,the Carrick Hills and Heads of Ayr,may be seen.The area was well known for its butter and cheese,and the town for its knitwear. The farms have belonged to the same families for many years while the town has grown in the last 30 years and now has many people from Glasgow and further afield.
